titles.title: Scrimshaw Production Licensing Extension Act of 1988
A bill to amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 with respect to the extension of licenses for scrimshaw production.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: 6/17/1988--Introduced. Scrimshaw Production Licensing Extension Act of 1988 - Amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (the Act) to renew for a six-month period certificates of exemption from the prohibition against sale of scrimshaw products and unworked whale ivory for certificate-holders whose certificates were renewed after October 13, 1982, and were in effect on March 31, 1988. Allows such certificate-holders to apply for one additional renewal for a period not to exceed five years. Prohibits, after January 31, 1984, any person from selling or offering for sale in interstate or foreign commerce, any pre-Act finished scrimshaw product unless such person holds a certificate of exemption and unless the product or raw material for the product was held by such person on October 13, 1982.
